intro: Apinella scabra, commonly known as the rough apinella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features serrated, rough-textured leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom during the warmer months. Apinella scabra is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
